Type.name: Functional
Type.Description:
Wrapper event for usage of Fn in a fluent style. Contains instance methods for operators, static methods for creation, all of which return values wrapped in a Functional for further calls. Functors and predicates are still used from Fn. The underlying value can be retrieved at the end of the chain with the <tt>get</tt> action.
eg: <tt>Functional.count().filter(Fn.even)).map((integer i)->i*2).slice(2, 8, 2);</tt>
You can create a Functional either using one of the static methods, or by wrapping a sequence, dictionary or generator directly.
eg: <tt>Functional([1,2,3,4]).filter(Fn.even).reduce(Fn.sum)</tt>
Type.Summary: Wrapper event for usage of Fn in a fluent style. Contains instance methods for operators, static methods for creation, all of which return values wrapped in a Functional for further calls. Functors and predicates are still used from Fn. The underlying value can be retrieved at the end of the chain with the <tt>get</tt> action.

Action.name: reduce
Action.Description:
Accumulates all of the contents using an accumulator function, returning the final result.
Works on a sequence or a dictionary. The result is the actual value, not a Functional, since it's no longer a container.
eg: <tt>numbers.reduce((integer a, integer i)->a+i)</tt>
Semantics are as <tt>Fn.reduce</tt>
Action.Summary: Accumulates all of the contents using an accumulator function, returning the final result.

Returns.Description: The final result of the accumulator function.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An accumulator function or lambda.

Action.name: generatorFrom
Action.Description:
Create a generator from a function, which is passed the previous value and should return the next value.
eg: <tt>Functional.generatorFrom(100, (integer i)->i+1)</tt>
Action.Summary: Create a generator from a function, which is passed the previous value and should return the next value.

Returns.Description: A generator for <tt>TYPE</tt>, wrapped in a functional.

Parameter.name: start
Parameter.Description: The value to pass to func to generate the first generation.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An <tt>action<TYPE> returns TYPE</tt> action or lambda which takes the previous value and returns the next value.

Action.name: count
Action.Description: Returns a Functional generator producing sequential integers with the first one being 0.
Action.Summary: Returns a Functional generator producing sequential integers with the first one being 0.

Action.name: generator
Action.Description:
Create a generator from a function, which is passed the previous value and should return the next value. The initial value will be a default-initialized <tt>TYPE</tt> and the result of first generation will be the result of invoking <tt>func</tt> on that default-initialized value. To specify the initial value, use generateFrom.
eg: <tt>Functional.generator((integer i)->i+1)</tt>
Action.Summary: Create a generator from a function, which is passed the previous value and should return the next value. The initial value will be a default-initialized <tt>TYPE</tt> and the result of first generation will be the result of invoking <tt>func</tt> on that default-initialized value. To specify the initial value, use generateFrom.

Returns.Description: A generator for <tt>TYPE</tt>, wrapped in a Functional.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An <tt>action<TYPE> returns TYPE</tt> action or lambda which takes the previous value and returns the next value.

Action.name: range
Action.Description: Returns a Functional range of integers from <tt>start</tt> (inclusive) to <tt>end</tt> (exclusive), incrementing <tt>stride</tt> each time.
Action.Summary: Returns a Functional range of integers from <tt>start</tt> (inclusive) to <tt>end</tt> (exclusive), incrementing <tt>stride</tt> each time.

Action.name: sequenceOf
Action.Description: Returns a sequence containing the given item the given number of times.
Action.Summary: Returns a sequence containing the given item the given number of times.

Returns.Description: A <tt>sequence<ITEMTYPE></tt> with <tt>n</tt> <tt>item</tt>s in it, wrapped in a Functional.

Parameter.name: item
Parameter.Description: The element to put in the sequence.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.Description: The number of times to repeat the element.

Action.name: consume
Action.Description:
Consume a given number of items from the contained generator and discard them.
Only works on generators.
Action.Summary: Consume a given number of items from the contained generator and discard them.

Returns.Description: This Functional operator with the generator stepped n times.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.Description: The number of times to step the generator.

Action.name: cycle
Action.Description: Iterates through a sequence of items and continues looping forever.
Action.Summary: Iterates through a sequence of items and continues looping forever.

Returns.Description: A generator which iterates over <tt>seq</tt>, wrapped in a Functional

Parameter.name: seq
Parameter.Description: The sequence of values to iterate over

Action.name: filter
Action.Description:
Filters the contents using a boolean predicate func.
Works on dictionary, sequence or generator.
eg: <tt>numbers.filter((integer i)->i%2=0)</tt>
Semantics are as <tt>Fn.filter</tt>
Action.Summary: Filters the contents using a boolean predicate func.

Returns.Description: A Functional container filtered using the predicate function.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: A boolean predicate function or lambda.

Action.name: quantify
Action.Description:
Counts how many times a predicate is true for the values of a sequence or dictionary. Works on a sequence or a dictionary. The result is an actual value, not a Functional, since it's no longer a container.
eg: <tt>numbers.quantify(Fn.even)</tt>
Action.Summary: Counts how many times a predicate is true for the values of a sequence or dictionary. Works on a sequence or a dictionary. The result is an actual value, not a Functional, since it's no longer a container.

Returns.Description: The number of values in the container for which the predicate returns true.

Parameter.name: pred
Parameter.Description: An action<TYPE> returns boolean.

Action.name: slice
Action.Description:
Returns a given sub-range as a finite sequence.
Works on sequence or generator. If it is a generator, it will invoke the generator sufficient times immediately to satisfy the slice.
eg: <tt>numbers.slice(5, 20, 2)</tt>
Action.Summary: Returns a given sub-range as a finite sequence.

Returns.Description: A Functional containing the selected range of values.

Parameter.name: start
Parameter.Description: The first item to return.

Parameter.name: end
Parameter.Description: The last item to return (-1 = all, only permitted for sequences).

Parameter.name: stride
Parameter.Description: The number of items to increment each time (1 = all).

Action.name: get
Action.Description: Return the wrapped container.
Action.Summary: Return the wrapped container.

Action.name: repeat
Action.Description: Repeats the given element forever.
Action.Summary: Repeats the given element forever.

Returns.Description: A generator which returns item over and over again, wrapped in a Functional.

Parameter.name: item
Parameter.Description: The item to return.

Action.name: accumulate
Action.Description: Returns a generator which accumulates over the underlying container, returning the result after accumulating each item. Similar to reduce, but returns a generator for each item in turn, rather than just the final total.
Action.Summary: Returns a generator which accumulates over the underlying container, returning the result after accumulating each item. Similar to reduce, but returns a generator for each item in turn, rather than just the final total.

Returns.Description: A generator which returns each accumulated item in turn, wrapped in a Functional.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An <tt>action<TYPEB,TYPEA> returns TYPEB</tt> action or lambda which accumulates each item in turn and returns the new total.

Action.name: argmap
Action.Description:
Use the contents as a list of arguments with which to invoke a function.
Works on a sequence or a generator.
These inner sequences will be treated as a list of arguments to the given function, or a single argument to that function. Each item in the result will be the result of calling func with the next set of arguments.
Action.Summary: Use the contents as a list of arguments with which to invoke a function.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: A function which takes each item in container and returns a result.

Action.name: map
Action.Description:
Maps the contents using a function.
Works on dictionary, sequence or generator.
eg: <tt>numbers.map((integer i)->i*2)</tt>
Semantics are as <tt>Fn.map</tt>
Action.Summary: Maps the contents using a function.

Returns.Description: The container with all the values run through func.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: A function or lambda from old value type to new value type.

Action.name: generate
Action.Description:
If this Functional is wrapping a generator, generate one item with the underlying generator and return it.
Only works on generators.
Action.Summary: If this Functional is wrapping a generator, generate one item with the underlying generator and return it.

Returns.Description: The next item from the wrapped generator.

Type.name: Partial
Type.Description:
A partially evaluated function which can be passed to functional operators or later executed with the remaining arguments.
eg: <tt>Partial p := Fn.partial(concatFn, "Hello"); <string>p.exec(" world");</tt>
Type.Summary: A partially evaluated function which can be passed to functional operators or later executed with the remaining arguments.

Action.name: partial
Action.Description: Add more partial arguments and return a new Partial which wraps this one.
Action.Summary: Add more partial arguments and return a new Partial which wraps this one.

Action.name: exec
Action.Description: Execute the underlying function, passing in the remaining arguments.
Action.Summary: Execute the underlying function, passing in the remaining arguments.

Returns.Description: The result of executing the underlying function with the original and remaining arguments.

Parameter.name: args
Parameter.Description: The remaining single argument, or sequence of all remaining arguments.

Type.name: Fn
Type.Description:
Provides functional operations on EPL containers, such as map, reduce, filter and slice.
Also provides generators which can be used as input to the functional operations.
eg: <tt>Fn.slice(Fn.map(Fn.filter(Fn.count(), (integer i)->i%2=0), (integer i)->i*2), 2, 8, 2);</tt>
Type.Summary: Provides functional operations on EPL containers, such as map, reduce, filter and slice.

Action.name: _any
Action.Description: Logical 'OR' over a sequence of booleans
Action.Summary: Logical 'OR' over a sequence of booleans

Parameter.name: seq
Parameter.Description: sequence<any> of booleans. Return false iff none of the items in the sequence are true. If seq is empty, returns false.

Action.name: mul
Action.Description:
Action for multiplying together the values in a sequence or generator of integer, float or decimal using accumulate or reduce.
eg: <tt>integer product := Fn.reduce(numbers, Fn.mul);</tt>
Action.Summary: Action for multiplying together the values in a sequence or generator of integer, float or decimal using accumulate or reduce.

Action.name: generator
Action.Description:
Create a generator from a function, which is passed the previous value and should return the next value. The initial value will be a default-initialized <tt>TYPE</tt> and the result of first generation will be the result of invoking <tt>func</tt> on that default-initialized value. To specify the initial value, use generateFrom.
eg: <tt>Fn.generator((integer i)->i+1)</tt>
Action.Summary: Create a generator from a function, which is passed the previous value and should return the next value. The initial value will be a default-initialized <tt>TYPE</tt> and the result of first generation will be the result of invoking <tt>func</tt> on that default-initialized value. To specify the initial value, use generateFrom.

Returns.Description: A generator for <tt>TYPE</tt>.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An <tt>action<TYPE> returns TYPE</tt> action or lambda which takes the previous value and returns the next value.

Action.name: increment
Action.Description: Increments the given integer
Action.Summary: Increments the given integer

Action.name: range
Action.Description: Returns a range of integers from <tt>start</tt> (inclusive) to <tt>end</tt> (exclusive), incrementing <tt>stride</tt> each time.
Action.Summary: Returns a range of integers from <tt>start</tt> (inclusive) to <tt>end</tt> (exclusive), incrementing <tt>stride</tt> each time.

Action.name: sequenceOf
Action.Description: Returns a sequence containing the given item the given number of times.
Action.Summary: Returns a sequence containing the given item the given number of times.

Returns.Description: A <tt>sequence<ITEMTYPE></tt> with <tt>n</tt> <tt>item</tt>s in it.

Parameter.name: item
Parameter.Description: The element to put in the sequence.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.Description: The number of times to repeat the element.

Action.name: sum
Action.Description:
Action for adding up a sequence or generator of integer, float or decimal using accumulate or reduce.
eg: <tt>integer sum := Fn.reduce(numbers, Fn.sum);</tt>
Action.Summary: Action for adding up a sequence or generator of integer, float or decimal using accumulate or reduce.

Action.name: whole
Action.Description: A predicate which returns true if the argument is a whole number.
Action.Summary: A predicate which returns true if the argument is a whole number.

Action.name: consume
Action.Description: Consume a given number of items from a generator and discard them.
Action.Summary: Consume a given number of items from a generator and discard them.

Returns.Description: a reference to the original generator, stepped n times.

Parameter.name: generator
Parameter.Description: The generator to step.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.Description: The number of times to step it.

Action.name: cycle
Action.Description: Iterates through a sequence of items and continues looping forever.
Action.Summary: Iterates through a sequence of items and continues looping forever.

Returns.Description: A generator which iterates over <tt>seq</tt>

Parameter.name: seq
Parameter.Description: The sequence of values to iterate over

Action.name: _all
Action.Description: Logical 'AND' over a sequence of booleans
Action.Summary: Logical 'AND' over a sequence of booleans

Parameter.name: seq
Parameter.Description: sequence<any> of booleans. Return true iff none of the items in the sequence are false. If seq is empty, returns true.

Action.name: istrue
Action.Description: A predicate which returns true if the argument is true.
Action.Summary: A predicate which returns true if the argument is true.

Action.name: negative
Action.Description: A predicate which returns true if the argument is negative.
Action.Summary: A predicate which returns true if the argument is negative.

Action.name: slice
Action.Description:
Takes either a sequence or a generator and returns a given sub-range as a finite sequence. If it is passed a generator, it will invoke the generator sufficient times immediately to satisfy the slice.
eg: <tt>Fn.slice(numbers, 5, 20, 2)</tt>
Action.Summary: Takes either a sequence or a generator and returns a given sub-range as a finite sequence. If it is passed a generator, it will invoke the generator sufficient times immediately to satisfy the slice.

Returns.Description: A <tt>sequence<TYPE></tt> containing the selected values from <tt>container</tt>

Parameter.name: container
Parameter.Description: A <tt>sequence<TYPE></tt> or generator which produces <tt>TYPE</tt>.

Parameter.name: start
Parameter.Description: The first item to return.

Parameter.name: end
Parameter.Description: The last item to return (-1 = all, only permitted for sequences).

Parameter.name: stride
Parameter.Description: The number of items to increment each time (1 = all).

Action.name: listenForAnyOf
Action.Description:
Takes a sequence of values and starts a listener one for each of them, with an action to call if any of those events arrive.
Equivalent to writing:
<tt>on all TypeName(fieldName=seq[0], otherfields=...) or TypeName(fieldName=seq[1], otherfields=...) or ... { arrivedAction(t); }</tt>
Action.Summary: Takes a sequence of values and starts a listener one for each of them, with an action to call if any of those events arrive.

Parameter.name: seq
Parameter.Description: sequence<any> of different values to listen to.

Parameter.name: typeName
Parameter.Description: The event type to listen for.

Parameter.name: fieldName
Parameter.Description: The name of the field for the values.

Parameter.name: otherFields
Parameter.Description: Names and values of other fields which will be the same for each listener.

Parameter.name: arrivedAction
Parameter.Description: The action to call if any matching events arrive.

Action.name: repeat
Action.Description: Repeats the given element forever.
Action.Summary: Repeats the given element forever.

Returns.Description: A generator which returns item over and over again.

Parameter.name: item
Parameter.Description: The item to return.

Action.name: accumulate
Action.Description: Returns a generator which accumulates over the underlying container, returning the result after accumulating each item. Similar to reduce, but returns a generator for each item in turn, rather than just the final total. The initial value of the accumulator is the default value of func's return type (<tt>TYPEB</tt>).
Action.Summary: Returns a generator which accumulates over the underlying container, returning the result after accumulating each item. Similar to reduce, but returns a generator for each item in turn, rather than just the final total. The initial value of the accumulator is the default value of func's return type (<tt>TYPEB</tt>).

Returns.Description: A generator which returns each accumulated item in turn.

Parameter.name: container
Parameter.Description: The sequence, dictionary or generator to accumulate.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An <tt>action<TYPEB,TYPEA> returns TYPEB</tt> action or lambda which accumulates each item in turn and returns the new total.

Action.name: map
Action.Description:
Takes either a sequence, a dictionary or a generator and maps the contents using a function. eg: Fn.map(numbers, (integer i)->i*2) Specifically, given:
  • sequence<TYPEA> container and action<TYPEA> returns TYPEB func will return sequence<TYPEB> containing the result of running func on all the elements in container.
  • dictionary<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPEA> container and action<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPEA> returns VALUETYPEB func will return dictionary<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPEB> containing the keys from container with the values being the result of running func.
  • A generator returning TYPEA and action<TYPEA> returns TYPEB func will return a generator returning TYPEB where each item is the corresponding item from the original generator after running func.
Action.Summary: Takes either a sequence, a dictionary or a generator and maps the contents using a function.

Returns.Description: The container with all the values run through func.

Parameter.name: container
Parameter.Description: A sequence, dictionary or generator.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: A function or lambda from old value type to new value type.

Action.name: reduce
Action.Description:
Takes either a sequence or a dictionary and accumulates all of the values using an accumulator function, returning the final result. eg: Fn.reduce(numbers, (integer a, integer i)->a+i) Specifically, given:
  • sequence<TYPEA> container and action<TYPEB,TYPEA> returns TYPEB func will return the final TYPEB after calling func on each value, retaining TYPEB each time.
  • dictionary<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPE> container and action<TYPEB,KEYTYPE,VALUETYPE> returns TYPEB func will return the final TYPEB after calling func on each key and value, retaining TYPEB each time.
Action.Summary: Takes either a sequence or a dictionary and accumulates all of the values using an accumulator function, returning the final result.

Returns.Description: The final result of the accumulator function.

Parameter.name: container
Parameter.Description: A sequence or dictionary.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An accumulator function or lambda.

Action.name: generatorFrom
Action.Description:
Create a generator from a function, which is passed the previous value and should return the next value.
eg: <tt>Fn.generatorFrom(100, (integer i)->i+1)</tt>
Action.Summary: Create a generator from a function, which is passed the previous value and should return the next value.

Returns.Description: A generator for <tt>TYPE</tt>.

Parameter.name: start
Parameter.Description: The value to pass to func to generate the first generation.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An <tt>action<TYPE> returns TYPE</tt> action or lambda which takes the previous value and returns the next value.

Action.name: count
Action.Description: Returns a generator producing sequential integers with the first one being 0.
Action.Summary: Returns a generator producing sequential integers with the first one being 0.

Action.name: concat
Action.Description: Action which concatenates strings using accumulate or reduce.
Action.Summary: Action which concatenates strings using accumulate or reduce.

Action.name: positive
Action.Description: A predicate which returns true if the argument is positive (not including 0).
Action.Summary: A predicate which returns true if the argument is positive (not including 0).

Action.name: odd
Action.Description: A predicate which returns true if the argument is odd.
Action.Summary: A predicate which returns true if the argument is odd.

Action.name: filter
Action.Description:
Takes either a sequence, a dictionary or a generator and filters the contents using a boolean predicate func. eg: Fn.filter(numbers, (integer i)->i%2=0) Specifically, given:
  • sequence<TYPE> container and action<TYPE> returns boolean func will return sequence<TYPE> containing all the elements for which func returned true.
  • dictionary<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPE> container and action<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPE> returns boolean func will return dictionary<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPE> containing all the elements for which func returned true.
  • A generator returning TYPE and action<TYPE> returns boolean func will return a generator returning TYPE which only generates items from the original generator for which func returned true.
Action.Summary: Takes either a sequence, a dictionary or a generator and filters the contents using a boolean predicate func.

Returns.Description: The container filtered using the predicate function.

Parameter.name: container
Parameter.Description: A sequence, dictionary or generator.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: A boolean predicate function or lambda.

Action.name: quantify
Action.Description:
Counts how many times a predicate is true for the values of a sequence or dictionary.
eg: <tt>Fn.quantify(numbers, Fn.even)</tt>
Action.Summary: Counts how many times a predicate is true for the values of a sequence or dictionary.

Returns.Description: The number of values in the container for which the predicate returns true.

Parameter.name: container
Parameter.Description: A sequence or dictionary.

Parameter.name: pred
Parameter.Description: An action<TYPE> returns boolean.

Action.name: reduceFrom
Action.Description:
Takes either a sequence or a dictionary and accumulates all of the values using an accumulator function, returning the final result. eg: Fn.reduceFrom(42, numbers, (integer a, integer i)->a+i) Specifically, given:
  • sequence<TYPEA> container and action<TYPEB,TYPEA> returns TYPEB func will return the final TYPEB after calling func on each value, retaining TYPEB each time.
  • dictionary<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPE> container and action<TYPEB,KEYTYPE,VALUETYPE> returns TYPEB func will return the final TYPEB after calling func on each key and value, retaining TYPEB each time.
Action.Summary: Takes either a sequence or a dictionary and accumulates all of the values using an accumulator function, returning the final result.

Returns.Description: The final result of the accumulator function.

Parameter.name: accumulator
Parameter.Description: initial value, of <tt>TYPEB</tt>

Parameter.name: container
Parameter.Description: A sequence or dictionary.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An accumulator function or lambda.

Action.name: even
Action.Description: A predicate which returns true if the argument is even.
Action.Summary: A predicate which returns true if the argument is even.

Action.name: _not
Action.Description: A predicate which inverts the value of another predicate.
Action.Summary: A predicate which inverts the value of another predicate.

Action.name: waitForAllCompleted
Action.Description:
Wait for completion of several asynchronous tasks.
Equivalent to writing:
<tt>on TypeName(fieldName=seq[0]) and TypeName(fieldName=seq[1]) and ... and not wait(timeout) { onCompleted(); }</tt>
Action.Summary: Wait for completion of several asynchronous tasks.

Parameter.name: seq
Parameter.Description: sequence<any> of values (typically IDs) to wait for.

Parameter.name: typeName
Parameter.Description: The type of event to wait for.

Parameter.name: fieldName
Parameter.Description: The field which will contain the values.

Parameter.name: onCompleted
Parameter.Description: an action<> to be called if all the events arrive within the timeout.

Parameter.name: onTimeout
Parameter.Description: an action<sequence<any>> to be called if some of the events don't arrive within the timeout. The argument will be all the values which did not arrive.

Action.name: argmap
Action.Description: Iterates through a sequence, or a generator and uses the result as a list of arguments with which to invoke a function. These inner sequences will be treated as a list of arguments to the given function, or a single argument to that function. Each generated item will be the result of calling func with the next set of arguments.
Action.Summary: Iterates through a sequence, or a generator and uses the result as a list of arguments with which to invoke a function. These inner sequences will be treated as a list of arguments to the given function, or a single argument to that function. Each generated item will be the result of calling func with the next set of arguments.

Parameter.name: container
Parameter.Description: A sequence or a generator.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: A function which takes each item in container and returns a result.

Action.name: accumulateFrom
Action.Description: Returns a generator which accumulates over the underlying container, returning the result after accumulating each item. Similar to reduce, but returns a generator for each item in turn, rather than just the final total.
Action.Summary: Returns a generator which accumulates over the underlying container, returning the result after accumulating each item. Similar to reduce, but returns a generator for each item in turn, rather than just the final total.

Returns.Description: A generator which returns each accumulated item in turn.

Parameter.name: start
Parameter.Description: The initial value of the accumulator; must have the same type as func's return type (<tt>TYPEB</tt>).

Parameter.name: container
Parameter.Description: The sequence, dictionary or generator to accumulate.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An <tt>action<TYPEB,TYPEA> returns TYPEB</tt> action or lambda which accumulates each item in turn and returns the new total.

Action.name: partial
Action.Description: Partially execute a function, providing some arguments, to be later executed with the remaining arguments. Arguments must be provided left-to-right for the function call to be invoked. eg: <tt>Partial p := Fn.partial(concatFn, "Hello"); <string>p.exec(" world");</tt> Partial objects can be passed to any of the other actions on Fn where an action would be expected.
Action.Summary: Partially execute a function, providing some arguments, to be later executed with the remaining arguments. Arguments must be provided left-to-right for the function call to be invoked. eg: <tt>Partial p := Fn.partial(concatFn, "Hello"); <string>p.exec(" world");</tt> Partial objects can be passed to any of the other actions on Fn where an action would be expected.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: A function (including an earlier partial()) to execute once all arguments are provided.

Parameter.name: args
Parameter.Description: The arguments to store for later execution. May be a single argument, or a sequence of several arguments.

Action.name: callAction
Action.Description: Functor to call the named action on the value.
Action.Summary: Functor to call the named action on the value.

Parameter.name: actionName
Parameter.Description: The name of the action to call.

Parameter.name: args
Parameter.Description: The arguments to call the action with.

Parameter.name: value
Parameter.Description: The object to call the action on.

Action.name: returnTypeInstanceOf
Action.Description: Return a new default instance of the return type of the function.
Action.Summary: Return a new default instance of the return type of the function.

Action.name: getGenericSequence
Action.Description: Convert value(s) of arg to a sequence<any> containing the value(s). If arg is not a sequence, create the sequence and put the value in it. If arg is already a sequence, copy the values from the sequence.
Action.Summary: Convert value(s) of arg to a sequence<any> containing the value(s). If arg is not a sequence, create the sequence and put the value in it. If arg is already a sequence, copy the values from the sequence.

Type.name: Generator
Type.Description: Represents a generator over a function. This class is used internally by Functional, but you can use any event with a generate method. Generate methods must take 0 arguments and can return the type of your choice (or any).
Type.Summary: Represents a generator over a function. This class is used internally by Functional, but you can use any event with a generate method. Generate methods must take 0 arguments and can return the type of your choice (or any).

Action.name: generate
Action.Description: Returns the next item from this generator.
Action.Summary: Returns the next item from this generator.

Returns.Description: The next item.
